alert.note: Alert for Butler; Edmonson; Grayson; Hardin; Hart; Warren (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 12:01PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hart, northeastern Butler, Grayson, northeastern Warren, south central Hardin and Edmonson Counties through 1245 PM EDT/1145 AM CDT/... At 1201 PM EDT/1101 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of Leitchfield, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Hart, Grayson, northeastern Warren, Edmonson, northeastern Butler and south central Hardin Counties, including the following locations... Cub Run, Broad Ford, Sunfish, Mammoth Cave, Priceville, Pine Springs, Iberia, Lone Star, Anneta and Sweeden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Edmonson; Grayson; Hardin; Hart; Warren
